question.title: How can I pad a String in Java?
question.body:
Is there some easy way to pad Strings in Java?

Seems like something that should be in some StringUtil-like API, but I can't find anything that does this.

answers.body:
This will allow padding of any string instead of limiting you to numbers, and code is clean and concise:

private static String leftPad(int length, char padCharacter, Object object) {
    StringBuilder builder = new StringBuilder();
    String string = object == null ? "" : object.toString();
    int remaining = Math.max(0, length - string.length());
    IntStream.range(0, remaining).forEach(i -> builder.append(padCharacter));
    return builder.append(string).toString();
}

For a quick and dirty test you can use this:

String myString = "hello";
for(;myString.length() < 32; hello = "0" + hello); //pad left
for(;myString.length() < 32; hello += "0"); //pad rigth
